item.title: Fitting and Interpreting a Proportional Odds Model
item.description: Take a look at the following table. It is a cross tabulation of data taken from the 1991 General Social Survey that relates political party affiliation to political ideology. (Agresti, An Introduction to Categorical Data Analysis, 1996) td { padding:0 15px 0 15px; text-align: center; } caption { font-size: 70% } Political Ideology by Party Affiliation, from the 1991 General Social Survey Very Liberal
